reasoning: Early-onset dementia (before age 65). Represents approximately 5-10% of all dementia cases. Estimated at ~9 per 100k person-years based on epidemiological studies. Lower confidence due to less robust population-based data compared to late-onset dementia.
source: Harvey RJ et al. (2003). Epidemiology of presenile dementia. Neurology. 60(9):1443-1447
